page.title: 17LEARNING IN WELSH
page.content: Despite most adults speaking English only, the area is able to provide a complete education up to University level in Welsh. The continuing growth of these schools shows the desire of young parents to maintain and encourage the use of the Welsh language which had almost become obsolete in this area. There are nursery schools where children begin to learn the language from the age of three and then progress to a Welsh language unit at a local primary school or to Welsh only primary schools in other areas. Secondary education can now be undertaken at a Welsh language comprehensive school at Rhydfelen which has been developing for the last 15 years and now teaches only through the medium of Welsh.
